critique: This document is an executive order from 1939 that exempts an employee of the Government Printing Office from mandatory retirement for one year. It is difficult to assess a strong political bias based on this document alone, as it appears to be a routine administrative decision. The order doesn't seem to have a direct impact on ideological tilt, immigration, federalism, national security, economic regulation, or social inclusion. However, the act of issuing an executive order could be seen as a slight expansion of executive power, although it's a very minor one in this case.
